subject: Re: I'd like to be able to write the prefixes com- and con- as contractions
msgSnippet: I was going to ask what is knish, but found the answer in Wikipedia! ... since those can not occur word- initially in English (K is mute where they occur in
messageBody:
I was going to ask what is knish, but found the answer in Wikipedia!


--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Michael Everson <everson@...>
wrote:
>
> On 19 Aug 2011, at 12:45, BPJ wrote:
>
> > In those cases you can safely write KN- (with reverse N) and KM-,
since those can not occur word- initially in English (K is mute where
they occur in TO).
>
> Except in knish. ;-)
>
> Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
>
